item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to My Book Reviews! Here I share detailed reviews of books I’ve read, including summaries, insights, and personal thoughts.

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: Atomic Habits is a practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones.

item.title: Deep Work
item.description: “Deep Work” emphasizes the importance of focused work without distractions. Newport explains how cultivating the ability to focus deeply is a superpower in today’s economy.

item.title: Grit: The Power of Passion and Perseverance
item.description: Duckworth explores why talent alone does not guarantee success. She emphasizes grit—a combination of passion and perseverance—as the key predictor of achievement.

item.title: Principles: Life and Work
item.description: Billionaire investor Ray Dalio shares the guiding principles that helped him build Bridgewater Associates into one of the world’s most successful hedge funds.

item.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
item.description: “Sapiens” traces the history of Homo sapiens from the emergence of cognitive abilities to the modern era. Harari combines anthropology, history, and sociology to explain how humans shaped the world and themselves

item.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
item.description: This book provides a principle-centered approach for solving personal and professional problems. Covey presents a holistic, integrated, principle-centered approach for achieving personal and interpersonal effectiveness

item.title: The Lean Startup
item.description: The Lean Startup introduces a methodology for developing businesses and products efficiently. It emphasizes validated learning, rapid experimentation, and pivoting.

item.title: The Power of Habit
item.description: Charles Duhigg explains the science of habits and how they influence our personal lives, businesses, and society. He introduces the habit loop (cue, routine, reward) and strategies to change habits.

item.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
item.description: This book explores the dual systems of the human mind: System 1 (fast, intuitive) and System 2 (slow, deliberate). Kahneman explains how these systems shape our judgments, decisions, and behaviors in everyday life.

item.title: Zero to One
item.description: Peter Thiel shares lessons from building startups and creating breakthrough innovations. The book emphasizes doing something new (“Zero to One”) rather than copying existing ideas.
